channel.title: yudel tweets
channel.description: A feed of recent tweets from yudel.

item.description: Your occasional reminder that in Florida, NASA powers its rockets with LOX. https://t.co/H37SV1pGAZ
item.source:markdown: Your occasional reminder that in Florida, NASA powers its rockets with LOX. https://t.co/H37SV1pGAZ

item.description: @aharonium @onthemainline Don’t know much about that field, I’m afraid.
item.source:markdown: @aharonium @onthemainline Don’t know much about that field, I’m afraid.

item.description: @joshtpm @TPM Seems like something the OMB would have been responsible for preventing, no? Seems like someone might want to speak to Mick… https://t.co/a6ahdWyKuw
item.source:markdown: @joshtpm @TPM Seems like something the OMB would have been responsible for preventing, no? Seems like someone might want to speak to Mick… https://t.co/a6ahdWyKuw

item.description:
@trekonomics It’s a classic. By which I mean it was genuinely mind blowing two generations ago.

@trekonomics I ploughed through it the summer I turned 13. I wasn’t that impressed; perhaps it was over my head.

@trekonomics But I doubt it was worse than Ivanhoe, which my English teacher tried to convince me has merit a couple years later.
Remember the Benghazi hearings. Never retreat. Never surrender. https://t.co/hOeju0MAHd
item.source:markdown: Remember the Benghazi hearings. Never retreat. Never surrender. https://t.co/hOeju0MAHd

item.description: This is the anti-halachic reality that Agudath Israel (@AgudahNews) endorsed. https://t.co/fhBzd0Dr01

item.description: Teaneck represent! (Rabbi Trachtenberg was longtime rabbi at Teaneck’s Temple Emeth.) https://t.co/VgqZsmhqU4
item.source:markdown: Teaneck represent! (Rabbi Trachtenberg was longtime rabbi at Teaneck’s Temple Emeth.) https://t.co/VgqZsmhqU4

item.description: @trekonomics You keep knocking American “cheese,” but what other food product has two continents and an isthmus named after it?
item.source:markdown: @trekonomics You keep knocking American “cheese,” but what other food product has two continents and an isthmus named after it?

item.description:
Your occasional reminder that a North Jersey teen went to NH to campaign for Ron Paul in 2011 and came back radicalized and started attacking synagogues. https://t.co/dY89x25TR3

It didn’t end well for him. https://t.co/6UA6wTwBFp

Nobody seems to have investigated who led him to throw his life away, but it seems like the quoted twitter account is a strong clue.
item.source:markdown:
Your occasional reminder that a North Jersey teen went to NH to campaign for Ron Paul in 2011 and came back radicalized and started attacking synagogues. https://t.co/dY89x25TR3
It didn’t end well for him. https://t.co/6UA6wTwBFp
Nobody seems to have investigated who led him to throw his life away, but it seems like the quoted twitter account is a strong clue.

item.description: @trekonomics I suspect these two weeks will play a disproportionate role in the trailer for the Hollywood film adaptation.
item.source:markdown: @trekonomics I suspect these two weeks will play a disproportionate role in the trailer for the Hollywood film adaptation.

item.description: @5DollarFeminist Shouldn’t there be a claim that allegedly improperly seized materials were (1) outside the scope of the warrant for specific reasons and (2) their seizure and review by the government constitute harm that requires immediate relief?
item.source:markdown: @5DollarFeminist Shouldn’t there be a claim that allegedly improperly seized materials were (1) outside the scope of the warrant for specific reasons and (2) their seizure and review by the government constitute harm that requires immediate relief?

item.description:
@hilzoy @TPM Maybe. But isn’t there a central govt agency in charge of processes? Maybe OMB? Were there centralized policies in place during the Obama administration or was it a free-for-all then too?

@hilzoy @TPM I mean, it’s not like Mick Mulvaney would have opposed government data retention when he headed OMB, right, given his reputation as an advocate of transparency and honesty?
item.source:markdown:
@hilzoy @TPM Maybe. But isn’t there a central govt agency in charge of processes? Maybe OMB? Were there centralized policies in place during the Obama administration or was it a free-for-all then too?
@hilzoy @TPM I mean, it’s not like Mick Mulvaney would have opposed government data retention when he headed OMB, right, given his reputation as an advocate of transparency and honesty?

item.description: @protecttruth_ @ElieNYC Judicial Watch no doubt believes that Separation of Powers bars Congress from regulating the President. The question ultimately is whether Alito agrees.
item.source:markdown: @protecttruth_ @ElieNYC Judicial Watch no doubt believes that Separation of Powers bars Congress from regulating the President. The question ultimately is whether Alito agrees.

item.description: Kahane might not have been right, but the right is now proudly Kahanaist. @tamares1869 צדק! https://t.co/qmZKNB1Rdh

item.description: @polypeptoad I suspect that the rabbi will likely be able to find someone willing to walk you home, and wouldn’t at all mind the request.
item.source:markdown: @polypeptoad I suspect that the rabbi will likely be able to find someone willing to walk you home, and wouldn’t at all mind the request.

item.description: @cooperlund “Getting stoned”
item.source:markdown: @cooperlund “Getting stoned”

item.description:
@trekonomics Is that prediction based on mass death, or just mass voluntary adoption of a one-child policy?

@trekonomics Maybe it’s unfair extrapolation from my own child rearing experience, but I find it hard to believe that a wealthy society that wanted a 2.1 child policy couldn’t achieve one by socializing the various costs involved.

@trekonomics “Refocusing on the danger of demographic decline, Space Karen donates to party committed to funding social science research and paid parental leave.”

In which the Czar’s government censors Jewish texts, including commentaries on Maimonides, for failing to oppose “sodomy” between a husband and wife. https://t.co/KTHDl3vEhC

Maybe Meir Soloveitchik ought to make sure that his Tikvah pal Gov. DeSantis has no plans to do the same, given his desire for the state to enforce perverse Christian sexual morality and opposition to a federal right of marital privacy.
item.source:markdown:
In which the Czar’s government censors Jewish texts, including commentaries on Maimonides, for failing to oppose “sodomy” between a husband and wife. https://t.co/KTHDl3vEhC
Maybe Meir Soloveitchik ought to make sure that his Tikvah pal Gov. DeSantis has no plans to do the same, given his desire for the state to enforce perverse Christian sexual morality and opposition to a federal right of marital privacy.

item.description: @MisfitTorah This is the flip side to raising more religious Jews that Torah uMesorah absolutely did not see coming.
item.source:markdown: @MisfitTorah This is the flip side to raising more religious Jews that Torah uMesorah absolutely did not see coming.

item.description: @datadivajf @MarisaElana They’re not trying to proselytize with this mailing — just get donations.
item.source:markdown: @datadivajf @MarisaElana They’re not trying to proselytize with this mailing — just get donations.

item.description: @datadivajf @MarisaElana Mailing lists are for sale. Question is whether it was a “Jewish names” list, or a Jewish organizational list. Whichever, I assume it’s the same way that AIPAC and JNF know to mail me stuff.
item.source:markdown: @datadivajf @MarisaElana Mailing lists are for sale. Question is whether it was a “Jewish names” list, or a Jewish organizational list. Whichever, I assume it’s the same way that AIPAC and JNF know to mail me stuff.

item.description: @MarisaElana But do you love $200 hotel savings?

item.description:
@saulnoamz Did you see the Lipa commercial for CBD gum?

@saulnoamz https://t.co/jsjMazlBY6

@saulnoamz Imagine telling Abbie Hoffman that in 50 years time chassidim would be producing Yiddish commercials for cannabis products!
